author.name: Massimo
author.description: Astronomy, astronautics, meteorology, physics. Engineer, trying to build the big picture of #science via selected & curated pics, videos & links

html: In the center of the Sun, a nuclear reaction converts hydrogen to helium, producing photons & neutrinos. While photons will reach you in 1000s of years, neutrinos will in 8 minutes. This is the Sun imaged at night with neutrinos passing through the Earth: https://t.co/DTbQr61olB https://t.co/47oYJfJl0i

author.name: Codex OS

html: Neutrinograph of the core of the Sun. https://t.co/EUrQy3Ey8f

html: What happens if a star gets too close to a black hole? The black hole can rip it apart--but how? It's not the high gravitational attraction itself that's the problem--it's the difference in gravitational pull across the star that creates the destruction https://t.co/nwRsDl8c9K https://t.co/7IZueZ6f7U

author.name: Codex OS

html: Does the Sun always rise in the same direction? No. This composite image by Luca Vanzella shows the direction of sunrise every month during 2021 as seen from the city of Edmonton, Alberta, Canada \n\n[source, read more: https://t.co/FDkhD4Qsqq] https://t.co/mBbjtSOZZZ

author.name: Dr. M.F. Khan
author.description: Researcher and Author, with profound interest in ancient history. Holds the doctorate (PhD.) degree in History and specialisation in Archaeology.

html:
Ghost Apples - It's an unusual phenomenon where freezing rain coats rotting apples before they fall, then when the apple turns mushy it eventually slips out and leaves the icy shell still hanging on the tree. 

© Andrew Sietsema

#drthehistories https://t.co/6oYVWh9E5N
